GOD.content: Christian “gift of death”: infinite love & goodness that infinitely forgets itself
GOD.linkedContent: Christian “gift of death”: infinite love & goodness that infinitely forgets itself

GOD.content: Gospels: God maintains trace of his suffering by “seeing in secret,” you forget suffering in his love, he forgets nothing
GOD.linkedContent: Gospels: God maintains trace of his suffering by “seeing in secret,” you forget suffering in his love, he forgets nothing

GOD.content: God counts the tears, forgets nothing

GT.content: forgetting of gift must be far more radical than repression, which always consists of keeping by exchanging places, its operation is systematic or topological
GT.linkedContent: forgetting of gift must be far more radical than repression, which always consists of keeping by exchanging places, its operation is systematic or topological

GT.content: absolute forgetting (oubli absolu) which unbinds (délie) absolutely or infinitely more than excuse, forgiveness, acquittal: certain experience of trace, cinder, ashes
GT.linkedContent: absolute forgetting (oubli absolu) which unbinds (délie) absolutely or infinitely more than excuse, forgiveness, acquittal: certain experience of trace, cinder, ashes

GT.content: forgetting and gift condition each other (unconditional)
something must come about in an instant, an instant that doesn’t belong to economy of time, time w/out time, a forgetting that forgets, but a forgetting that’s not nothing
GT.linkedContent: something must come about in an instant, an instant that doesn’t belong to economy of time, time w/out time, a forgetting that forgets, but a forgetting that’s not nothing

GT.content: Blanchot says, more or less, forgetting is another name for Being
GT.linkedContent: Blanchot says, more or less, forgetting is another name for Being

GT.content: the alogos, madness, of rendering account (logos) of the atopos (the gift), desire to think the impossible, to desire, to desire to give the impossible: madness as given & desired forgetting
GT.linkedContent: the alogos, madness, of rendering account (logos) of the atopos (the gift), desire to think the impossible, to desire, to desire to give the impossible: madness as given & desired forgetting

GT.content: how could one desire a gift that is non-ambivalent? a gift that would not be pharmakon, poison, that would be good? how does one desire forgetting
GT.linkedContent: how could one desire a gift that is non-ambivalent? a gift that would not be pharmakon, poison, that would be good? how does one desire forgetting

GT.content: is madness the movement of the circle or its excess? besieges reason at its 2 borders (inside & outside)
GT.linkedContent: is madness the movement of the circle or its excess? besieges reason at its 2 borders (inside & outside)

GT.content: linked to double bind (stricture, ligature, obligation) > absolve, forget absolutely & forgive by giving (lier et délier absolument)
GT.linkedContent: linked to double bind (stricture, ligature, obligation) > absolve, forget absolutely & forgive by giving (lier et délier absolument)

GT.content: madness linked to double bind as the bind & the non-bind or débandade: folie de la garde ou de la capitalisation hypermnésique, et folie de la dépense oublieuse; eats away at language, burns up word or meaning of “gift,” spreads its ashes w/out return; that which does not return to the father
GT.linkedContent: madness linked to double bind as the bind & the non-bind or débandade: folie de la garde ou de la capitalisation hypermnésique, et folie de la dépense oublieuse; eats away at language, burns up word or meaning of “gift,” spreads its ashes w/out return; that which does not return to the father

GT.content: subject as such: bordered, posed, identified, always calculates, reappropriates surplus-value, circular return, a certain capitalization
GT.linkedContent: subject as such: bordered, posed, identified, always calculates, reappropriates surplus-value, circular return, a certain capitalization

GT.content: despite labor of subject, production of surplus-value, gift takes place where there’s trace, dissemination, in excessive forgetting, forgetful excess of the gift
GT.linkedContent: despite labor of subject, production of surplus-value, gift takes place where there’s trace, dissemination, in excessive forgetting, forgetful excess of the gift

GT.content: annihilation of a remainder, as ashes sometimes testify, can play role of memory, of offering, of sacrifice
GT.linkedContent: annihilation of a remainder, as ashes sometimes testify, can play role of memory, of offering, of sacrifice

GT.content: violence of gift: takes by surprise in such a way as to trap, indebt the receiver, place, hold in a process of circulation, but this violence irreducible whether it repeats or interrupts the circle
GT.linkedContent: violence of gift: takes by surprise in such a way as to trap, indebt the receiver, place, hold in a process of circulation, but this violence irreducible whether it repeats or interrupts the circle

GT.content: or: a surprise surprising enough to be forgotten w/out delay, beyond Being, epekeina tes ousia: secret about which one cannot speak, but can no longer remain silent
GT.linkedContent: or: a surprise surprising enough to be forgotten w/out delay, beyond Being, epekeina tes ousia: secret about which one cannot speak, but can no longer remain silent

MONL.content: they have a short memory = out of training
MONL.linkedContent: they have a short memory = out of training

MONL.content: amnesia is active, dynamic, something other than mere forgetfulness
MONL.linkedContent: amnesia is active, dynamic, something other than mere forgetfulness

MONL.content: break with tradition, uprooting, amnesia w/out recourse: all of these unleash the genealogical drive, the desire of the idiom, impulse to anamnesis, destructive love of the interdict, tattooing of all colors on the body [see AF p. 10 erogenous color draws mask]
MONL.linkedContent: break with tradition, uprooting, amnesia w/out recourse: all of these unleash the genealogical drive, the desire of the idiom, impulse to anamnesis, destructive love of the interdict, tattooing of all colors on the body [see AF p. 10 erogenous color draws mask]

MONL.content: madness of a hypermnesia, a supplement of loyalty, commit to traces of writing: toward an anamnesis of the entirely other > this is the most difficult thing [Aristotle says same about virtue]
MONL.linkedContent: madness of a hypermnesia, a supplement of loyalty, commit to traces of writing: toward an anamnesis of the entirely other > this is the most difficult thing [Aristotle says same about virtue]

OOG.content: in phenomenology, forgetfulness, a phenomenon of the ego, can never be radical
OOG.linkedContent: in phenomenology, forgetfulness, a phenomenon of the ego, can never be radical

OOG.content: new reduction (epochē) developed in Crisis cannot be a forgetting or negating, a subtraction or devaluation of what it de-sediments or neutralizes
OOG.linkedContent: new reduction (epochē) developed in Crisis cannot be a forgetting or negating, a subtraction or devaluation of what it de-sediments or neutralizes

MC.content: “a lapsus gives another truth a chance”

AF.content: archive requires repetition, repetition permits memory but is indissociable from death drive—so archive introduces forgetfulness, archiviolithic, always works against itself [auto-immunity]
AF.linkedContent: archive requires repetition, repetition permits memory but is indissociable from death drive—so archive introduces forgetfulness, archiviolithic, always works against itself [auto-immunity]

AF.content: death drive destroys archive, unless it can be made up as idol, represented, painted, erotic simulacrum
AF.linkedContent: death drive destroys archive, unless it can be made up as idol, represented, painted, erotic simulacrum

AF.content: death drive is archive fever, not a principle, aneconomy, threatens every principality, every archontic primacy, every archival desire: its silent vocation > burn the archive, incite amnesia, ruin archive as accumulation and capitalization of memory
AF.linkedContent: death drive is archive fever, not a principle, aneconomy, threatens every principality, every archontic primacy, every archival desire: its silent vocation > burn the archive, incite amnesia, ruin archive as accumulation and capitalization of memory

AF.content: entire economy of archival law found in these 2 words: memorial & reminder
AF.linkedContent: entire economy of archival law found in these 2 words: memorial & reminder

SPOM.content: dividing line of figural inheritance: mechanical reproduction of specter, and “an appropriation…so alive, so interiorizing” that it is life as forgetting, forgetting the maternal, “to make spirit live in oneself”
SPOM.linkedContent: dividing line of figural inheritance: mechanical reproduction of specter, and “an appropriation…so alive, so interiorizing” that it is life as forgetting, forgetting the maternal, “to make spirit live in oneself”

SPOM.content: the 2 types of forgetting in Marx: 1) forgetting of revolutionary inheritance, forget specter (primitive, mother tongue), pre-inheritance, & parody, appropriate life of new language so that history can continue [remember while forgetting enough]; Marx: find again spirit of revolution w/out making its specter return 2) bourgeois forgetting: content to forget
SPOM.linkedContent: the 2 types of forgetting in Marx: 1) forgetting of revolutionary inheritance, forget specter (primitive, mother tongue), pre-inheritance, & parody, appropriate life of new language so that history can continue [remember while forgetting enough]; Marx: find again spirit of revolution w/out making its specter return 2) bourgeois forgetting: content to forget

SPOM.content: these 2 modalities contaminate each other in conjuration (or convoking) of dead because simulacrum consists in miming ghost or in simulating the phantasm of the other > but Marx holds to this [this?] difference as he holds to life
SPOM.linkedContent: these 2 modalities contaminate each other in conjuration (or convoking) of dead because simulacrum consists in miming ghost or in simulating the phantasm of the other > but Marx holds to this [this?] difference as he holds to life

SPOM.content: once revolutionary task sets in, amnesia occurs, nothing but forgetting, “anachrony practices and promises forgetting”
SPOM.linkedContent: once revolutionary task sets in, amnesia occurs, nothing but forgetting, “anachrony practices and promises forgetting”

SPOM.content: question of head, cap-, spirit > amnesiac order of capitalist bourgeoisie, the muzzle (gueule) replaces head at summit
SPOM.linkedContent: question of head, cap-, spirit > amnesiac order of capitalist bourgeoisie, the muzzle (gueule) replaces head at summit

SPOM.content: Marx’s revolutionary injunction “let the dead bury the dead”, the imperative of an “active forgetting,” as Nietzsche would put it
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx’s revolutionary injunction “let the dead bury the dead”, the imperative of an “active forgetting,” as Nietzsche would put it

SPOM.content: neither the dead nor the living (the “only living,” the immortal living, the gods) have buried anyone (Marx knows this) > il faudra toujours que des mortels encore vivants enterrent des vivants déjà morts ——spirit of past [not ghost?] convoked to anesthetize itself (sich betäuben), protects against its “own content,” protects against itself, makes you forget why and that you’re violent
SPOM.linkedContent: neither the dead nor the living (the “only living,” the immortal living, the gods) have buried anyone (Marx knows this) > il faudra toujours que des mortels encore vivants enterrent des vivants déjà morts ——spirit of past [not ghost?] convoked to anesthetize itself (sich betäuben), protects against its “own content,” protects against itself, makes you forget why and that you’re violent

POOF.content: “truth, freedom, necessity, and equality come together in the politics of fraternity”
POOF.linkedContent: “truth, freedom, necessity, and equality come together in the politics of fraternity”

POOF.content: isn’t there no chance for a perhaps here? for an absolute housebreak or hospitality, an arrivance? > Greek fraternity founded on a perhaps that brought about its own forgetting, the forgetting of the perhaps [Heidegger’s forgetting of Being]
POOF.linkedContent: isn’t there no chance for a perhaps here? for an absolute housebreak or hospitality, an arrivance? > Greek fraternity founded on a perhaps that brought about its own forgetting, the forgetting of the perhaps [Heidegger’s forgetting of Being]

POOF.content: would the decision be free or not? active or passive? conscious or unconscious? is the decision always linked to oblivion itself?
POOF.linkedContent: would the decision be free or not? active or passive? conscious or unconscious? is the decision always linked to oblivion itself?

POOF.content: event of death reveals/effaces ‘truth’ of friendship, oblivion is necessary, faut l’oubli > friendship w/out memory, by gentleness & rigor of fidelity, friendship for the solitary > Nietzsche already demanded “community w/out community”: la mort est l’épreuve suprême de cette déliaison
POOF.linkedContent: event of death reveals/effaces ‘truth’ of friendship, oblivion is necessary, faut l’oubli > friendship w/out memory, by gentleness & rigor of fidelity, friendship for the solitary > Nietzsche already demanded “community w/out community”: la mort est l’épreuve suprême de cette déliaison

POOF.content: it is thanks to death that friendship can be declared, and never if not recalling > friendship declared during lifetime avows the same thing [so what is significance of actual death?]
POOF.linkedContent: it is thanks to death that friendship can be declared, and never if not recalling > friendship declared during lifetime avows the same thing [so what is significance of actual death?]

MPM.content: fidelity requires that one quote, let other speak, and that one not restrict oneself to quoting > double law of Mnemosyne or common law of double source Mnemosyne/Lethe
MPM.linkedContent: fidelity requires that one quote, let other speak, and that one not restrict oneself to quoting > double law of Mnemosyne or common law of double source Mnemosyne/Lethe

MPM.content: Paul de Man translates Hegel’s “Ich kann nicht sagen was ich (nur) meine” as ‘I cannot say I’ > effacing of I, a priori functional forgetting > “Autobiography as De-facement”
MPM.linkedContent: Paul de Man translates Hegel’s “Ich kann nicht sagen was ich (nur) meine” as ‘I cannot say I’ > effacing of I, a priori functional forgetting > “Autobiography as De-facement”

MPM.content: de Man: memory of present is “a forgetting or a suppression of anteriority,” “memory effaces remembrance”
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: memory of present is “a forgetting or a suppression of anteriority,” “memory effaces remembrance”

MPM.content: must keep in memory difference of Lethe from Mnemosyne, call this aletheia
MPM.linkedContent: must keep in memory difference of Lethe from Mnemosyne, call this aletheia

MPM.content: promise of the other (for the future, trace of the future) made to the other as an absolute past, the other’s sur-vival exceeds the “we” of a common present: brings together two friends, “incredible scene of memory,” written in absolute past; dictates madness of amnesic fidelity, forgetful hypermnesia, gravest and lightest
MPM.linkedContent: promise of the other (for the future, trace of the future) made to the other as an absolute past, the other’s sur-vival exceeds the “we” of a common present: brings together two friends, “incredible scene of memory,” written in absolute past; dictates madness of amnesic fidelity, forgetful hypermnesia, gravest and lightest

MPM.content: we must remember the power of forgetting (what tradition calls “bad”: pharmakon, sign, figure of allegory) as opposed to forgetting in the sense of interior “recollection”
MPM.linkedContent: we must remember the power of forgetting (what tradition calls “bad”: pharmakon, sign, figure of allegory) as opposed to forgetting in the sense of interior “recollection”

MPM.content: “even if this memory of prefiguration were possible, we know that it would offer no ‘anteriority’ that was not fictive or figural; it could only 'suppress' or ‘forget’ it”
MPM.linkedContent: “even if this memory of prefiguration were possible, we know that it would offer no ‘anteriority’ that was not fictive or figural; it could only 'suppress' or ‘forget’ it”

A.content: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage
A.linkedContent: all politics require time & space of mourning, a topolitology of sepulcher, anamnesic (thematic) relation to spirit as revenant, open hospitality to guest as ghost [in English] whom one holds, as he holds us, hostage

EM.content: isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]
EM.linkedContent: isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]

PP.content: memory and truth cannot be separated, movement of alētheia, a deployment of mnēmē as psychic life in its self-presentation to itself > powers of lēthē (writing, pharmakon) increase domains of death, nontruth, nonknowledge: fascinate, hypnotize, medusa [verb]
PP.linkedContent: memory and truth cannot be separated, movement of alētheia, a deployment of mnēmē as psychic life in its self-presentation to itself > powers of lēthē (writing, pharmakon) increase domains of death, nontruth, nonknowledge: fascinate, hypnotize, medusa [verb]

PP.content: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)
PP.linkedContent: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)

PAS.content: forgetting is another name for pas, affecting without return the being of “is”
PAS.linkedContent: forgetting is another name for pas, affecting without return the being of “is”

PAS.content: Derrida proposes we hear Blanchot’s viens, a coming back w/out memory (le sous-venir sans mémoire), in Heidegger’s Ereignis
PAS.linkedContent: Derrida proposes we hear Blanchot’s viens, a coming back w/out memory (le sous-venir sans mémoire), in Heidegger’s Ereignis

PAS.content: double pas provokes double instantaneous but interminable preterition, forms a singular limit btwn keeping and loss, remembering and forgetting
PAS.linkedContent: double pas provokes double instantaneous but interminable preterition, forms a singular limit btwn keeping and loss, remembering and forgetting

PAS.content: pas est l’oubli, pas d’oubli doublement affirmé (oui, oui)
PAS.linkedContent: pas est l’oubli, pas d’oubli doublement affirmé (oui, oui)

PAS.content: an infinite patience that crosses the limit in one stroke, a forgetting that overflows all philosophical and psychoanalytic determinations w/out omitting their pertinence
PAS.linkedContent: an infinite patience that crosses the limit in one stroke, a forgetting that overflows all philosophical and psychoanalytic determinations w/out omitting their pertinence

PAS.content: forgetting beyond all our categories of forgetting (beyond economy of repressions working toward protection)
PAS.linkedContent: forgetting beyond all our categories of forgetting (beyond economy of repressions working toward protection)

PAS.content: every revolution needs to take account of Blanchot’s forgetting, forgetting w/out forgetting, a forgetting beyond the protection of repression, a forgetting that describes the whole history of dissimulation > pas d’autre ——X that is l’oubli tout autre is also the same X of philosophy, science
PAS.linkedContent: every revolution needs to take account of Blanchot’s forgetting, forgetting w/out forgetting, a forgetting beyond the protection of repression, a forgetting that describes the whole history of dissimulation > pas d’autre ——X that is l’oubli tout autre is also the same X of philosophy, science

PAS.content: nothing presents itself [in approach of “terrifyingly ancient,” terrifyingly becoming “subject” not accessory adverb], fors l’obscène (save the obscene), what awaits as forgetting
PAS.linkedContent: nothing presents itself [in approach of “terrifyingly ancient,” terrifyingly becoming “subject” not accessory adverb], fors l’obscène (save the obscene), what awaits as forgetting

PAS.content: Blanchot: I forget nothing, it is in this way que j’appartiens à l’oubli
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: I forget nothing, it is in this way que j’appartiens à l’oubli

PAS.content: [on not citing his sources] the worst méconaissance of Blanchot’s text, hand over incommensurable in it to the market, the hierarchy, the dominant effects tied to name & law, but [other voice] there’s always benefits of mastery for sovereign renunciation, it’s gonna happen, il faut en rendre compte, the gift itself never forgets itself, nor the forgetting
PAS.linkedContent: [on not citing his sources] the worst méconaissance of Blanchot’s text, hand over incommensurable in it to the market, the hierarchy, the dominant effects tied to name & law, but [other voice] there’s always benefits of mastery for sovereign renunciation, it’s gonna happen, il faut en rendre compte, the gift itself never forgets itself, nor the forgetting

PAS.content: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas
PAS.linkedContent: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas

PAS.content: forgetting must guard itself (se guarder) to preserve the gift, so the gift can give, the bank (berge) and contamination poison the gift
PAS.linkedContent: forgetting must guard itself (se guarder) to preserve the gift, so the gift can give, the bank (berge) and contamination poison the gift

PAS.content: to give must forget all the way up to what is given, one gives without having self (sans s’avoir)
PAS.linkedContent: to give must forget all the way up to what is given, one gives without having self (sans s’avoir)

PAS.content: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift
PAS.linkedContent: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift

PAS.content: Blanchot: solemn and noble procession toward what goal? and then forgetfulness came
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: solemn and noble procession toward what goal? and then forgetfulness came

OH.content: we must not forget programs that do not forget us [re: Eurocentrism, anti-Eurocentrism]
OH.linkedContent: we must not forget programs that do not forget us [re: Eurocentrism, anti-Eurocentrism]

OH.content: must be suspicious of repetitive memory and tout autre of absolutely new [cf. POOF p. 65], of anamnestic capitalization & amnesic exposure to what would no longer be identifiable
OH.linkedContent: must be suspicious of repetitive memory and tout autre of absolutely new [cf. POOF p. 65], of anamnestic capitalization & amnesic exposure to what would no longer be identifiable

OH.content: in the dated nature of dating, of currentness, lies a disquieting wrinkle, stigmata of anachrony marking all our days > traditional discourse of modernity, discourse of anamnesis w/ its goût de fin, if not for death
OH.linkedContent: in the dated nature of dating, of currentness, lies a disquieting wrinkle, stigmata of anachrony marking all our days > traditional discourse of modernity, discourse of anamnesis w/ its goût de fin, if not for death

OH.content: horizon (ancient Greek) = limit; to see itself (Europe) on the horizon, is to see itself from its end, discourse of anamnesis—taste for finality (goût de fin), for death
OH.linkedContent: horizon (ancient Greek) = limit; to see itself (Europe) on the horizon, is to see itself from its end, discourse of anamnesis—taste for finality (goût de fin), for death

OH.content: we did not choose this responsibility of our heritage [it is from the other, the language of our language], nor the capitalizing memory we have of it
OH.linkedContent: we did not choose this responsibility of our heritage [it is from the other, the language of our language], nor the capitalizing memory we have of it

TC.content: theater/festival of cruelty could only take place one time, w/out reserve, return, economy, history, must be forgotten, à la Nietzsche’s active forgetting (aktive Vergesslichkeit)
TC.linkedContent: theater/festival of cruelty could only take place one time, w/out reserve, return, economy, history, must be forgotten, à la Nietzsche’s active forgetting (aktive Vergesslichkeit)

SH.content: ideality carries forgetting in its memory, the memory of forgetting itself, the truth of forgetting > reference to singular event annulled in ring’s annulation, the date’s turning-about, una volta, volte-face, revolt, revolution
SH.linkedContent: ideality carries forgetting in its memory, the memory of forgetting itself, the truth of forgetting > reference to singular event annulled in ring’s annulation, the date’s turning-about, una volta, volte-face, revolt, revolution

SH.content: date es gibt, annulment at work when date inscribes its here and now in iterability, consigns itself to self-forgetfulness, succeeds in effacing itself
SH.linkedContent: date es gibt, annulment at work when date inscribes its here and now in iterability, consigns itself to self-forgetfulness, succeeds in effacing itself

SH.content: poem is a hermeneutic event, it has philosophical implications which draw out the limits of hermeneutic acuity; limit of philosophy and formal poetics not to be renounced, not a failure: they recall the forgetting of the mark’s annulment by forgetting it (by supposing date)
SH.linkedContent: poem is a hermeneutic event, it has philosophical implications which draw out the limits of hermeneutic acuity; limit of philosophy and formal poetics not to be renounced, not a failure: they recall the forgetting of the mark’s annulment by forgetting it (by supposing date)

FWT.content: “one must forget well” (basically same transubstantiation as) “one must eat well”: il faut bien oublier la mort, il faut bien manger ——love object is perpetuated in being betrayed/forgotten, the one who died must be forgotten
FWT.linkedContent: “one must forget well” (basically same transubstantiation as) “one must eat well”: il faut bien oublier la mort, il faut bien manger ——love object is perpetuated in being betrayed/forgotten, the one who died must be forgotten

SP.content: possible forgetting [?] of their code makes all texts open, undecipherable, and structurally posthumous (the author will die w/ the key inside, will forget it even)
SP.linkedContent: possible forgetting [?] of their code makes all texts open, undecipherable, and structurally posthumous (the author will die w/ the key inside, will forget it even)

SP.content: for Heidegger, forgetting of a being incommensurable w/ forgetting of Being: [Derrida quotes Heidegger: can’t understand forgetting as a human fact, as omission, Being not umbrella of distracted philosopher, forgetting attacks essence of Being, is the Destiny of the essence of Being]
SP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, forgetting of a being incommensurable w/ forgetting of Being: [Derrida quotes Heidegger: can’t understand forgetting as a human fact, as omission, Being not umbrella of distracted philosopher, forgetting attacks essence of Being, is the Destiny of the essence of Being]

OTO.content: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]
OTO.linkedContent: phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]

OTO.content: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]
OTO.linkedContent: Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]

FS.content: like structuralism, no concept of force in Husserl (brings phenomenology back to Platonism despite professed anti-Platonism); for Husserl, truth requires forgetting [of genesis, force, failure, crises]
FS.linkedContent: like structuralism, no concept of force in Husserl (brings phenomenology back to Platonism despite professed anti-Platonism); for Husserl, truth requires forgetting [of genesis, force, failure, crises]

FS.content: when all value 1st constituted by theoretical subject, diaphanousness is supreme value, univocity > hence, difficulty in thinking genesis & mysterious failures called crises
FS.linkedContent: when all value 1st constituted by theoretical subject, diaphanousness is supreme value, univocity > hence, difficulty in thinking genesis & mysterious failures called crises

FS.content: Husserl’s solution: forgetting is eidetically dictated, necessary, under rubric of “sedimentation” > for the development of truth
FS.linkedContent: Husserl’s solution: forgetting is eidetically dictated, necessary, under rubric of “sedimentation” > for the development of truth

FS.content: not abandon ourselves to structural formalism: must attempt emancipation, but only as a dream, emancipation is impossible unless we forget our history [contra Nietzsche?]
FS.linkedContent: not abandon ourselves to structural formalism: must attempt emancipation, but only as a dream, emancipation is impossible unless we forget our history [contra Nietzsche?]

DIF.content: Heidegger: when the essence of presencing unnoticeably becomes something present, the distinction btwn presencing and what is present (Anwesen und Anwesendem) is forgotten
DIF.linkedContent: Heidegger: when the essence of presencing unnoticeably becomes something present, the distinction btwn presencing and what is present (Anwesen und Anwesendem) is forgotten

DIF.content: forgetting of ontological difference: disappearance of trace of trace > Heidegger: even the early trace (die frühe Spur) is obliterated when presence is in the position of the highest
DIF.linkedContent: forgetting of ontological difference: disappearance of trace of trace > Heidegger: even the early trace (die frühe Spur) is obliterated when presence is in the position of the highest

WAP.content: institution can forget its own elect (finite memory), its finitude also effects remembrance of what it wants to exclude: the surface of its archive thus inscribed w/ what it refuses, excludes (ex: Walter Benjamin not receiving a degree)
WAP.linkedContent: institution can forget its own elect (finite memory), its finitude also effects remembrance of what it wants to exclude: the surface of its archive thus inscribed w/ what it refuses, excludes (ex: Walter Benjamin not receiving a degree)

SW.content: signature (operation of poetic writing) must not be absolutely invulnerable: an “I” signs in the place of the wound (the other operates on us w/out knowing)—so virtual that it remains > bears bereaved memory of an unrefusable lesion > seems older than self: you may have forgotten it, but it carries on dictating all the blows of fate (as if we desired even the worst of them)
SW.linkedContent: signature (operation of poetic writing) must not be absolutely invulnerable: an “I” signs in the place of the wound (the other operates on us w/out knowing)—so virtual that it remains > bears bereaved memory of an unrefusable lesion > seems older than self: you may have forgotten it, but it carries on dictating all the blows of fate (as if we desired even the worst of them)

TB.content: does a work require translation? answer is apodictic, injunction even w/out translator there, the requirement of the other as translator: structure of original, relation of life to survival > a priori, even if forgotten > its apodictic essence: it is unforgettable, so forgetting is accidental, death would not change it at all
TB.linkedContent: does a work require translation? answer is apodictic, injunction even w/out translator there, the requirement of the other as translator: structure of original, relation of life to survival > a priori, even if forgotten > its apodictic essence: it is unforgettable, so forgetting is accidental, death would not change it at all

CHM.content: no history except of rationality/meaning: reappropriation of negativity—or forgets it (same thing) > history of truth, history of economy of negative: negativity not positive truth is the nonhistorical capital of history
CHM.linkedContent: no history except of rationality/meaning: reappropriation of negativity—or forgets it (same thing) > history of truth, history of economy of negative: negativity not positive truth is the nonhistorical capital of history

CHM.content: Derrida’s deconstruction of Foucault not a philosophia perrenis: historicity of philosophy located btwn hyperbole & finite structure, btwn closed totality and what exceeds it, in difference btwn history & historicity, in moment btwn hyperbole/madness/Cogito & forgetting > another statement of excess that’ll become another decline/crisis
CHM.linkedContent: Derrida’s deconstruction of Foucault not a philosophia perrenis: historicity of philosophy located btwn hyperbole & finite structure, btwn closed totality and what exceeds it, in difference btwn history & historicity, in moment btwn hyperbole/madness/Cogito & forgetting > another statement of excess that’ll become another decline/crisis

CHM.content: crisis: 1) acc. Husserl, menace to reason/meaning by way of objectivism, forgetting of origins 2) krinein, choice & division btwn 2 ways: meaning, non-meaning (Parmenides’ logos and non-way [labyrinth, the palintrope]), division in which logos (in necessary violence of its irruption) separates from itself as madness, forgets its origin [back to 1)]—finitude > possibility as crisis?
CHM.linkedContent: crisis: 1) acc. Husserl, menace to reason/meaning by way of objectivism, forgetting of origins 2) krinein, choice & division btwn 2 ways: meaning, non-meaning (Parmenides’ logos and non-way [labyrinth, the palintrope]), division in which logos (in necessary violence of its irruption) separates from itself as madness, forgets its origin [back to 1)]—finitude > possibility as crisis?

CHM.content: identity btwn consciousness of crisis & forgetting of it > crisis of reason: access to reason and attack of reason > Foucault teaches us to think: crises of reason in strange complicity w/ crises of madness
CHM.linkedContent: identity btwn consciousness of crisis & forgetting of it > crisis of reason: access to reason and attack of reason > Foucault teaches us to think: crises of reason in strange complicity w/ crises of madness

EJQB.content: is not the writing of the question, the first violence re: the question, a first response and repose, l’errance (wandering) as history, first crisis, first forgetting, the dissimulation of l’errance?
EJQB.linkedContent: is not the writing of the question, the first violence re: the question, a first response and repose, l’errance (wandering) as history, first crisis, first forgetting, the dissimulation of l’errance?

EJQB.content: books are always books of life, or of afterlife > written questions addressed to literature are forgotten, drained, by literature (mortifications, ruses of life, life negating itself in literature to survive): writing would die of pure vigilance to question (and also simple erasure of question)
EJQB.linkedContent: books are always books of life, or of afterlife > written questions addressed to literature are forgotten, drained, by literature (mortifications, ruses of life, life negating itself in literature to survive): writing would die of pure vigilance to question (and also simple erasure of question)

EJQB.content: absolute interrogation (of God) will never belong to the book
EJQB.linkedContent: absolute interrogation (of God) will never belong to the book

D.content: trace can only imprint itself by referring to another trace (the other), letting itself be upstaged (outrepasser)/forgotten: its force of production stands in relation to energy of its erasure
D.linkedContent: trace can only imprint itself by referring to another trace (the other), letting itself be upstaged (outrepasser)/forgotten: its force of production stands in relation to energy of its erasure

IW.content: via Renan, brutal unity of nation requires active, selective forgetting, one can’t tolerate something at origin of nation: act of originary violence, unavowable curse
IW.linkedContent: via Renan, brutal unity of nation requires active, selective forgetting, one can’t tolerate something at origin of nation: act of originary violence, unavowable curse

IW.content: national forgetting as remembering a future promise (promise structurally involves forgetting, essential indifference to past)
IW.linkedContent: national forgetting as remembering a future promise (promise structurally involves forgetting, essential indifference to past)

IW.content: “desire to live together,” performative engagements, promises, inscribe necessity of forgetting in memory itself
IW.linkedContent: “desire to live together,” performative engagements, promises, inscribe necessity of forgetting in memory itself

PJP.content: le parjure forgot to remember the duty of memory (infinite at every instant), memory must be an ethical obligation [I did not think that I had to not forget]
PJP.linkedContent: le parjure forgot to remember the duty of memory (infinite at every instant), memory must be an ethical obligation [I did not think that I had to not forget]

PJP.content: amnesia, irreducible distraction, disappearance at heart of finite thought: the resource, power of anacoluthon [see p. 194]
PJP.linkedContent: amnesia, irreducible distraction, disappearance at heart of finite thought: the resource, power of anacoluthon [see p. 194]

HST.content: no forgiveness w/out memory (but not reducible to act of memory), forgiveness is, above all, not to forget [Jankelevitch]
HST.linkedContent: no forgiveness w/out memory (but not reducible to act of memory), forgiveness is, above all, not to forget [Jankelevitch]

HST.content: that forgiveness is not forgetting [?] makes us laugh through tears/anguish
HST.linkedContent: that forgiveness is not forgetting [?] makes us laugh through tears/anguish

TN.content: is it possible to change climates? I believe not > I don’t really believe this, not in an instant, w/ a loss of memory
TN.linkedContent: is it possible to change climates? I believe not > I don’t really believe this, not in an instant, w/ a loss of memory

NOY.content: promise of memory, memory of promise, before all psychē, all morality
NOY.linkedContent: promise of memory, memory of promise, before all psychē, all morality

NOY.content: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity
NOY.linkedContent: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity

NOY.content: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second”
NOY.linkedContent: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second”

NOY.content: forgetting repetition in the promise so that “yes” is absolutely inaugural and “free”
NOY.linkedContent: forgetting repetition in the promise so that “yes” is absolutely inaugural and “free”

TINON.content: “cinder” [ashes] renders better what Derrida meant by trace, remaining w/out remaining, cinder is not!, testifies w/out testifying, destruction of memory itself, absolute radical forgetting: absolute non-memory communicates w/ gift—not seeking to be recognized or saved; incineration as elementary form of experience
TINON.linkedContent: “cinder” [ashes] renders better what Derrida meant by trace, remaining w/out remaining, cinder is not!, testifies w/out testifying, destruction of memory itself, absolute radical forgetting: absolute non-memory communicates w/ gift—not seeking to be recognized or saved; incineration as elementary form of experience

AD.content: for Levinas, forgetting the other would attest to its absolute truth
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, forgetting the other would attest to its absolute truth

CF.content: all Nation-States founded in violence, all culture a type of colonialism > foundation scripted into State order to hide itself, sublimation/celebration of beginning as amnesia
CF.linkedContent: all Nation-States founded in violence, all culture a type of colonialism > foundation scripted into State order to hide itself, sublimation/celebration of beginning as amnesia

CIN.content: if you no longer recall it, it’s because the incineration/consummation of cinder proceeds from cinder itself > trace destined like everything to disappear so as to lose its way or rekindle a memory
CIN.linkedContent: if you no longer recall it, it’s because the incineration/consummation of cinder proceeds from cinder itself > trace destined like everything to disappear so as to lose its way or rekindle a memory

BSi.content: chase chimeras, centaurs: to forget them, domesticate them, repress them, cause them to flee
BSi.linkedContent: chase chimeras, centaurs: to forget them, domesticate them, repress them, cause them to flee

OG.content: to think writing first, a perversion, dangerous promiscuity, origin ungraspable, the violence of forgetting, auxiliary meaning not living (not spontaneous); representation mingles (s’enlace) w/ what it represents; infinite reference (renvoi): le double dédouble ce qu’il redouble
OG.linkedContent: to think writing first, a perversion, dangerous promiscuity, origin ungraspable, the violence of forgetting, auxiliary meaning not living (not spontaneous); representation mingles (s’enlace) w/ what it represents; infinite reference (renvoi): le double dédouble ce qu’il redouble

OG.content: for Rousseau, origin as beginning of end, inaugural decadence, separation btwn song & speech: growth of music parallels writing as “dangerous supplement” > gradual forgetting (of voice of nature) usurps, separates, deprives: re-placement as effacement by forgetting
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, origin as beginning of end, inaugural decadence, separation btwn song & speech: growth of music parallels writing as “dangerous supplement” > gradual forgetting (of voice of nature) usurps, separates, deprives: re-placement as effacement by forgetting

OG.content: forgetting & repression inadequate ideas to explain finitude & dissimulation > forgetting & repression both products of a philosophy (of meaning)
OG.linkedContent: forgetting & repression inadequate ideas to explain finitude & dissimulation > forgetting & repression both products of a philosophy (of meaning)

CIR.content: they can’t stand that I say nothing refutable (nor tenable, nor valid), my capacity for silence & amnesia, not a strategy but “violence of the void through which God goes to earth to death in me”
CIR.linkedContent: they can’t stand that I say nothing refutable (nor tenable, nor valid), my capacity for silence & amnesia, not a strategy but “violence of the void through which God goes to earth to death in me”

CIR.content: never been able to contradict myself, still so young [cf. SW pp. 322-23], unforgettable power of my discourse—they grind even the mute ash, name of God in the ash > so I write, convenient for forgetting
CIR.linkedContent: never been able to contradict myself, still so young [cf. SW pp. 322-23], unforgettable power of my discourse—they grind even the mute ash, name of God in the ash > so I write, convenient for forgetting
